00:24:14	Benedikt Wagner:	Replying to "Is there a need to c..."

Assuming you are referring to the hash inside the signature scheme: If you modify it, it is a different scheme and no longer the standardized one. At the same time, you may gain some advantages wrt L1-zkEVMs or aggregation of these signatures (which we don‚Äôt do for ECDSA, but may be interesting for large PQ signatures)
00:24:21	Benedikt Wagner:	Reacted to "This is something to..." with üëç
00:24:40	Renaud-ZKNOX:	falcon propose this separation of hash directly in the precompile, we did a FALZKON in Cairo, replacing keccak by a more zk friendly function (blake2s has its AIR)
00:24:47	Parthasarathy Ramanujam:	Replying to "Is there a need to c..."

00:53:57	Stefa:	It's a really broad technique, it works with pretty much every key-derivation step which involves at least one cryptographic hashing step between master seed and master key. BIP-32 and ECDSA are an interesting special case, but they are very much a special case.
